Name:
HMS Ceylon
BAP Coronel Bolognesi
Out of service: Transferred to Peruvian Navy on 9 February 1960
Propulsion:
Four oil fired three-drum Admiralty-type boilers
four-shaft geared turbines
four screws
54.1 megawatts (72,500 shp)
processing systems:
Type 281 air search
Type 272 surface search
Type 277 height finding
Type 274 fire control (6 inch guns)
Type 283 fire control (4 inch guns)
Type 282 fire control (2 pdr guns)
Armament:
3 triple BL 6 inch Mk XXIII guns (152 mm)
4 twin QF 4 inch Mk XIX guns
4 quadruple QF 2-pounder Mk VII (40 mm) "pom-pom" guns
10 twin Oerlikon 20 mm Mk II guns
2 triple 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
